intro: Centella lasiophylla, commonly known as the rough-leaf centella, is a perennial herb native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, ovate leaves with a rough texture. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its stems are often匍匐 (creeping) and bear opposite leaves with serrated edges. The flowers are small, white or pale pink, and appear in clusters, followed by small, round berries.
